sentences.en: Customers pay to log on and gossip with other users.
sentences.cn: 顾客付费后登录系统和其他用户聊天。

sentences.en: Do you want to hear some juicy gossip ?
sentences.cn: 你想听些有趣的传闻吗？

sentences.en: Don't believe all the gossip you hear.
sentences.cn: 别对那些道听途说都信以为真。

sentences.en: Don't you like a good gossip?
sentences.cn: 你不想好好地聊聊吗？

sentences.en: Eva gossiped with Sarah.
sentences.cn: 伊娃与萨拉闲聊。

sentences.en: He was a vicious gossip.
sentences.cn: 他总是喜欢说别人的坏话。

sentences.en: Her existence was lightened by bits of gossip.
sentences.cn: 她的生活靠了飞短流长才不那么乏味。

sentences.en: It provided some juicy gossip for a few days.
sentences.cn: 这制造了一些非常八卦的流言蜚语，足够说上几天的。

sentences.en: It was common gossip how he felt about her.
sentences.cn: 他对她的看法，大家都在议论纷纷。

sentences.en: On Sundays all the men gather in the square to exchange local gossip .
sentences.cn: 每到星期天，男人们就聚集在广场上，飞短流长地说一些当地的新闻。

sentences.en: Phil’s in there, having a gossip with Maggie.
sentences.cn: 菲尔在那里面跟玛吉闲聊。

sentences.en: Rick’s a terrible gossip.
sentences.cn: 里克就爱说三道四。

sentences.en: She despised gossip in any form.
sentences.cn: 她对任何形式的流言蜚语都嗤之以鼻。

sentences.en: She had no time for idle gossip .
sentences.cn: 她没有时间说长道短。

sentences.en: She had no time for idle gossip.
sentences.cn: 她没有时间说长道短。

sentences.en: She was not interested in the trivia of gossip.
sentences.cn: 她对琐碎的流言蜚语不感兴趣.

sentences.en: That might merely have been malicious gossip.
sentences.cn: 那也许仅仅是些不怀好意的流言蜚语罢了。

sentences.en: The jet-setting couple made frequent appearances in the gossip columns.
sentences.cn: 这对穿梭于各国的富豪夫妇经常出现在八卦专栏。

sentences.en: The newspaper reports are a mixture of gossip, lies and half-truths.
sentences.cn: 报纸的这些报道尽是些流言蜚语、谎言和真假参半的内容。

sentences.en: The whole town was gossiping about them.
sentences.cn: 全镇的人都在议论他们。

sentences.en: There has been much gossip about the possible reasons for his absence.
sentences.cn: 关于他缺席的原因有很多传言。

sentences.en: They spread a lot of tacky gossip about his love life.
sentences.cn: 关于他的爱情生活,他们散播了许多不堪的闲言闲语.

sentences.en: This story will be more fodder for the gossip columnists.
sentences.cn: 这个传闻会是闲谈专栏作家的又一素材。

sentences.en: We read the gossip written about them with prurient interest.
sentences.cn: 我们翻看他们的八卦时带着不洁的想法。

sentences.en: We spoke, debated, gossiped into the night.
sentences.cn: 我们交谈、争论、闲聊到夜间。

sentences.en: What’s the latest gossip ?
sentences.cn: 最近有些什么传闻？

sentences.en: Who knows how much of the gossip was true.
sentences.cn: 有谁知道这些流言蜚语有多少是真的呢？

sentences.en: You miss a lot of office gossip when you have a day off work.
sentences.cn: 请一天假，你就会错过办公室里的许多小道消息。

sentences.en: You must avoid gossip and focus on what you have to do.
sentences.cn: 务必避免流言蜚语，关注你必须做的事务。

trans.tran_cn: 流言蜚语，闲话，爱说长道短的人
trans.tran_en: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks
If you gossip with someone, you talk informally, especially about other people or local events. You can also say that two people gossip.
to talk about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including remarks that are unkind or untrue
